snippet: Anti-American protesters, who want a nuclear deal but not any improvement in ties with Washington, have turned up the dial on vitriolic displays.
abstract: Some influential religious leaders in Iran are increasing anti-American rhetoric as nuclear pact with United States becomes likely; analysts say reaction to oversell anti-Americanism is fueled by fears bond will bring increased engagement and cooperation with what is seen as evil Western influence.

byline.contributor: Jonathan Weisman contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Anti-American protesters, who want a nuclear deal but not any improvement in ties with Washington, have turned up the dial on vitriolic displays.

headline.main: Iran’s Hard-Liners Sharpen Attacks on U.S. as Nuclear Talks Continue
headline.print_headline: Iran’s Hard-Liners Sharpen Attacks on U.S. as Talks Continue
